title: Baileys Flat White Martini Recipe
description: This espresso martini with Baileys Original Irish Cream is as easy as 1, 2, 3. Impress your guests with this fancy cocktail at your next dinner party!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips Baileys Baileys Flat White Martini 4.7 (9) 9 Reviews 13 Photos This espresso martini with Baileys Original Irish Cream tastes as good as it looks! Submitted by Baileys Updated on November 20, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 13 13 13 13 Prep Time: 5 mins Total Time: 5 mins Servings: 1 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 2 ounces Baileys® Original Irish Cream 1 ounce vodka 1 ounce brewed espresso ice cubes Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour Baileys into a cocktail shaker. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour vodka into the cocktail shaker. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour espresso into the cocktail shaker. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add ice into the cocktail shaker; shake well. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Strain into a martini glass. Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 285 Calories 0g Fat 28g Carbs Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 1 Calories 285 % Daily Value * Total Fat 0g 0% Sodium 16mg 1% Total Carbohydrate 28g 10% Total Sugars 25g Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 8mg 1% Potassium 35mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Baileys Flat White Martini 01 of 13 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 13 Photo by  Jennifer Kislig 04/23/2021 03 of 13 Photo by  What's for dinner, mom? 12/17/2017 I made the recipe exactly as directed. So good! Easy to drink, easy to make, simple ingredients. Loved it. 04 of 13 Photo by  tcasa 12/16/2017 Love it! Very simple quick yet elegant martini to make. It tasted like a dessert instead of a drink which I will say becareful they may sneak up on you:) I used regular coffee instead of espresso and drizzled a cold martini glass with chocolate prior to adding the mixed drink. I also made a non alcoholic version of the drink using Baileys non-alcoholic creamer for the kids. Will definitely be making these again! 05 of 13 Photo by  tcasa 12/16/2017 Love it! Very simple quick yet elegant martini to make. It tasted like a dessert instead of a drink which I will say becareful they may sneak up on you:) I used regular coffee instead of espresso and drizzled a cold martini glass with chocolate prior to adding the mixed drink. I also made a non alcoholic version of the drink using Baileys non-alcoholic creamer for the kids. Will definitely be making these again! 06 of 13 Photo by  Aja 12/15/2017 This was pretty yummy, but dangerous though cause this martini tasted like a delectable dessert drink. Forgot there was vodka in it for a minute and started drinking it quicker than needed. I shook a little bit of ground espresso in the drink as well as rimmed the glass with a little espresso powder and tiny bit of sugar. However this drink is already cloyingly sweet so adding any sugar is not needed even though the presentation is nice! 07 of 13 Photo by  Aja 12/15/2017 This was pretty yummy, but dangerous though cause this martini tasted like a delectable dessert drink. Forgot there was vodka in it for a minute and started drinking it quicker than needed. I shook a little bit of ground espresso in the drink as well as rimmed the glass with a little espresso powder and tiny bit of sugar. However this drink is already cloyingly sweet so adding any sugar is not needed even though the presentation is nice! 08 of 13 Photo by  Tracey Ferrari Posner 12/15/2017 This martini is good! I do have to say that it took 2 servings to fill the glass but it was delicious! No changes needed! And, definitely no complaints! Next time though, I want to try grating a cocoa covered espresso bean on top to just make it even more elegant. 09 of 13 Photo by  B Tario 12/12/2017 This was incredibly smooth and delicious martini. Very easy to make an even better to enjoy. I will definitely be making this again. 10 of 13 Photo by  B Tario 12/12/2017 This was incredibly smooth and delicious martini. Very easy to make an even better to enjoy. I will definitely be making this again. 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Baileys Almande Iced Coffee 5 Ratings Hot Nutty Irish Coffee Baileys Tiramisu 3 Ratings Frozen Irish Cream 2 Ratings Irish Cream and Coffee 33 Ratings Mexican Affogato Holiday Cappuccino 1 Rating The Best Irish Coffee 42 Ratings Dalgona Cocktail 1 Rating Mexican-Style Coffee 11 Ratings Spanish Coffee 3 Ratings Kilbeggan® Irish Coffee Coffee Nudge 17 Ratings Mexican Coffee Cocktail 5 Ratings Holiday Coffee Liquor 8 Ratings Tito's Snow Day Sipper Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
